events.name: Meeting Young Minds @ BIT 2016
events.description:
Synopsis 
Innovation is the key to business success. Today, disruptive innovations emerge ever so often to render traditional business models irrelevant. The ability to innovate is now critical for organizations seeking growth, reducing cost and ensuring survival. 
Is an innovation simply the result of an incredible, un-replicable “Aha” moment or can it be systematically designed? How can an organization position itself as a hot-bed for disruptive innovations generated from within? How does one measure innovation success? 
Join us at the 14th MeetingYoungMind@BIT seminar as we address these questions and showcase the technological innovations built as a collaboration between our final year graduating cohort and industry partners. 

Programme Details 
2.00pm 
Arrival of Guests. Networking Session (Drinks will be served) 
2.30pm 
Event Launch by Director of School of Business, Mr. Daniel Yeow  
2.45pm 
Panel Discussion: Innovations by Design. Join us as we discuss issues and perspectives on driving innovations with technology together with industry experts in these areas. 
3.30pm to 5.00pm 
Reception. Technology Solution Showcase. (Light refreshments will be served) 

Panellist Profiles 
 
Ms. Julee (Hyunju Lee)  VP Head of User Experience and Design at honestbee.com and Founder & CDO of UXStudio.Co 
With 12 years of experience in diverse industries all across the globe, Hyunju has led teams to deliver world-class products that consider customer experiences via multiple touch points. Her extensive design skills that bridge various disciplines, along with her keen customer empathy have been vital in redefining user experiences for renowned clients such as PayPal, Intuit, Cisco, Yahoo! and Samsung. Driven by her sense of innovation, her portfolio has delighted millions of users and includes 11 patents with the USPTO. 
Hyunju graduated from Carnegie Mellon University with a Bachelor of Fine Arts in Communication Designs and a Master of Arts in Digital Media Management from Hyper Island. 
  
 
Mr. Mike Han.   Business Solution Director, Aevistrack Pte Ltd   
Mike Han is Business Solutions Director at Aevistrack Pte Ltd, a company he founded to develop and provide tracking solutions for healthcare, militaries, warehouse logistics, aerospace, manufacturing, retail and tourism sectors using technologies such as RFID, WIFI and other proprietary real-time tracking devices. Prior to the founding of Aevistrack, Mike was the IT Project Manager at KPMG Singapore where he spear headed the firm’s Global Integrated Business System project. 
Mike possesses deep knowledge and experience in tracking systems through the numerous implementation that he spearheaded in his previous roles as the Head of Software Department at Wavex Technologies and Director of Hub-Neutrons. 
Mike graduated from the National University of Singapore with a Bachelor’s Degree in Computing. 
  
 
Mr. Aloysius Lau  Managing Director, SAFESURE Engineering Pte Ltd 
Aloysius is an entrepreneur who started his first IT solutions company in 2001 at the age of 14. He has since successfully founded and exited from 5 start-up ventures. 
He is currently the Managing Director of SAFESURE Engineering Pte Ltd, an engineering solutions and renovation company. He is also on board as Director and Business Advisor to several young companies specializing in digital marketing, big data analytics, mobility solutions and online marketplace. 
Aloysius graduated from Temasek Polytechnic in 2008 with a Diploma in Business Information Technology from Temasek Polytechnic (TP) where he was placed on Directors’ Honors List. In 2014, Aloysius graduated with a Bachelor of Science in Information Systems Management from Singapore Management University on full scholarship.
events.group_name: Temasek Polytechnic School of Business, Diploma in Business IT

events.name: Monthly meet - DDOS and DNS Hijacking
events.description:
Null meets are free for anyone to attend. There are absolutely no fees. Just come with an open mind and willingness to share and learn Agenda:  Introduction & Networking  Security News Bytes by Drupan Chandarana (Above are of 15 mins each) DNS Hijacking by Michael Smith, Security CTO of Akamai All you ever wanted to know about DDoS attacks - and how to defend against them by Marek Majkowski, CloudFlare (Each presentation is of 45 mins duration)  Abstract of the talk  All you ever wanted to know about DDoS attacks - and how to defend against them CloudFlare is constantly facing a DDoS threat. Each day we mitigate between 30 and 300 DDoS attacks. In this talk, I will describe the technical details of all the attack types we see, why they are a problem, and how we defend against them. In essence: all you ever wanted to know  about DDoS compressed in a 40 minute talk. Some of theslides will be borrowed from this BlackHat talk:https://www.blackhat.com/eu-15/briefings.html#marek-majkowski 



Speaker bio:Michael Smith serves as the APJ Chief Technology Officer for Security for Akamai and is responsible for supporting sales, professional services, product management, and operations.Previously, Mr Smith was the Founder and Director of Akamai’s Customer Security Incident Response Team.  Marek MajkowskiAfter fruitful encounters with such diverse topics as high performance key value databases, distributed queueing systems, making real time web communication enjoyable, and accelerating the time so that testing servers and protocols takes seconds, Marek Majkowski finally settledfor working on DDoS mitigation in the CloudFlare London office, where he appreciates most the parking space for his motorbike. Drupan Chandarana is a Network Automation Specialist , works closely with Network Engineerings for large scale deployment of Network Devices and pushing configurations changes using automation. Drupan is a security enthusiast and working towards getting into security domain in the near future.  See you all there !
events.location: The Working Capitol, The Commons Room, 1 Keong Saik Road, 089109, Singapore
events.group_name: Null Singapore - The Open Security Community

events.name: Automate cross platform workflows with Docker
events.description:
Learn more about Docker and containers and how it impacts the DevOps scene moving forward. Agenda: 1) Introduction to Docker 2) Docker vs traditional VMs 3) Cross platform deployment using Docker on Azure 4) Future of containers 5) *NEW* Hands on Lab. We will have a 20 min hands on lab - Docker on Azure. No installation needed, so if you'd like to follow through the labs, do bring your laptops.  


Speaker: Ujjwal Kumar, Senior Technical Evangelist, Microsoft 


Food will be provided, 6.45pm
events.location: 22CF12, Level 22, Microsoft Singapore, Singapore 018989, One Marina Boulevard
events.group_name: Visual Studio ALM and TFS Singapore

events.name: Hackware v1.5: PCB Special
events.description:
Hackware is a monthly meetup for hardware developers and enthusiasts to share hacks and developments in the hardware scene, promote hardware development and to build a community of hardware developers. 

Come and just drop by for all our open and free meetups, make friends with fellow enthusiasts or beginners and feel free to sign up for a talk slot on whatever you are working on.

Agenda & Talks for this meetup:

1. (5 min) Intro to NUS Enterprise by Charleen Phor
2. (20 min) My PCB business card by Yeo Kheng Meng
3. (10 min) Maker Faire Singapore 2016 by Kiruthika Curic
4. (20min) One Man Foxconn - Misadventures in pcb design and assembly by Jeremias Wong (https://github.com/nushackers/schnrk)
5. (15min) Homemade PCB with Iron press by Leon Lim
6. (5min) ArduinoMKR1000 by Teo Tian Lye (https://www.arduino.cc/en/Main/ArduinoMKR1000)

7. Announcements by anyone on:
- Hiring positions
- Available for hire
- Other upcoming hardware-related events locally or anywhere else

8. Show and Tell

Talks : ~20mins
Talks typically include side projects of speakers on electronics, embedded system, radio communications, internet of things and much more. We want to hear about an electronics project that you already implemented at home or anywhere.

Lightning Talks : ~5mins
Lightning talks are short electronics demo that are working or even incomplete based on open source hardware and software. We wanna see all your fried chips and electronics to be fixed. Nothing has to be perfect - we are all learning. Bring them! 
(No product videos or proprietery technology.)

Announcements: ~1min
Announcement can be done by anyone looking to get hired or hire someone. Talk about your project / company and tell us who you are looking for.

Show and Tell: ~free and easy 
Bring your completed / uncompleted hardware projects and ask for feedback and share your learnings.

Venue sponsored by NUS Enterprise, Plug-In@Blk71: http://www2.blk71.com/
events.location: NUS Enterprise at Blk 71, 71 Ayer Rajah Crescent,  #02-01
